901 Main

Modern apartments in a classic neighborhood

Light, fresh, home

Today’s amenities and plenty of natural light highlight these modern, urban apartments!

901 Main is located at... 901 Main Street! This three-story, mixed-use urban development offers two levels of one and two-bedroom apartments above first floor commercial space in the middle of the action. Each unit offers residents inviting indoor and outdoor living spaces, in-unit, full-size washers and dryers, daylight in every bedroom (yes, a window!) and below-grade, climate-controlled parking.

  • 1 - 2 bedroom apartments
  • 750 - 1050 square feet
  • Underground parking
  • Pet friendly
  • Balconies
  • In-unit washer and dryer

We are pet friendly!

What better feature could we offer than to be located across the street from the new Whitney Bark Park—the city’s first off-leash dog area within Whitney Park? Enjoy a beautiful summer evening or a new-fallen snow with your four-legged friend at the year-round Bark Park, a mere 200 feet away from your front door.

Pets are welcome at 901 Main for a small additional fee. Waste facilities will be provided on-site for residents.

Plans and pricing

Each one-bedroom unit is approximately 750 square feet, with a living room, kitchen, private bedroom and tub/shower bathroom. Each two-bedroom unit is approximately 1,050 square feet with a large, shared tub/shower bathroom. Each unit contains full-size washers and dryers and includes a balcony for outdoor entertaining.

Rents begin at $950 for one-bedroom units and $1,350 for two-bedroom units. Below-grade, climate-controlled parking is available for an additional fee on a first-rented, first-served basis.

Contact us today to get started

Contact us today for more details and/or to reserve your unit—we'll be in touch soon!

Explore the neighborhood

Bars, restaurants, and coffee

Beer, coffee, or dinner within blocks of home. Eat at home tonight? Why?!

Retail services

What every urban dweller needs quick access to: everyday essentials! Milk, eggs, and... aspirin. Hey, we don't judge!

Whitney Bark Park

You probably won't find Snoopy at Whitney Bark Park, but you will find many of Green Bay's four-legged friends and their owners enjoying this year-round, fenced-in, off-leash dog area.

Parks and recreational trails

Whitney Park is the oldest park in the city, offering generous shade in the summer months as well as multiple community events and gatherings.
